actions-list.actionItem: Pursuant to the order of yesterday, the Journal of the proceedings of the Senate was deemed approved to date.
Pursuant to the order of yesterday, the morning hour being deemed expired, and the times for the recognition of the two leaders being reserved.
The following transactions of morning business occurred on today.

S.Res. 581 (Sen. Blunt Rochester):
        A resolution honoring the life of Corporal Grade One Matthew T. "Ty" Snook of the Delaware State Police.

        -- Senate Committee on the Judiciary discharged by Unanimous Consent.

        -- Resolution agreed to in Senate without amendment and with a preamble by Unanimous Consent.

PN726-5:
        David Clay Fowlkes, of Arkansas, to be United States District Judge for the Western District of Arkansas

        -- Considered by Senate.

        -- Confirmed by the Senate by Yea-Nay Vote. 54 - 40. Record Vote Number: 22 



 PN726-6:
        Nicholas Jon Ganjei, of Texas, to be United States District Judge for the Southern District of Texas

        -- By unanimous consent agreement, mandatory quorum required under Rule XXII waived.

        -- Cloture invoked in Senate by Yea-Nay Vote. 49 - 44. Record Vote Number: 23 


        -- Considered by Senate.

        -- Confirmed by the Senate by Yea-Nay Vote. 51 - 45. Record Vote Number: 24 



 PN726-11:
        Justin R. Olson, of Indiana, to be United States District Judge for the Southern District of Indiana

        -- Motion to proceed to executive session to consideration of nomination agreed to in Senate by Voice Vote.

        -- Cloture motion presented in Senate.


 PN726-12:
        Aaron Christian Peterson, of Alaska, to be United States District Judge for the District of Alaska

        -- By unanimous consent agreement, mandatory quorum required under Rule XXII waived.

        -- Cloture invoked in Senate by Yea-Nay Vote. 55 - 39. Record Vote Number: 25 


        -- Considered by Senate.
By unanimous consent, on the request of Mr. Banks, at  5:19 p.m., the Senate adjourned, under its order of today, until 10 a.m. tomorrow.
